newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SWIMMING-ELLEM WINS SECOND WORLD BREASTSTROKE GOLD.
newsitem.headline: SWIMMING-ELLEM WINS SECOND WORLD BREASTSTROKE GOLD.

text.p: Fifteen-year-old Australian Kristy Ellem completed a golden double at the world short-course swimming championships when she won an extremely close women's 100 metres breaststroke final on Saturday.
Ellem, who won Friday's 200 breaststroke with nearly three seconds to spare, had no such leeway in the shorter race and secured victory in her final lunge to the wall.

She claimed Australia's seventh title of the four-day championships in one minute 8.27 seconds, just 0.06 seconds ahead of Poland's Alicja Peczak, who added a silver to the bronze she won in the event in 1995.
Ukraine's Svitlana Bondarenko, silver medallist last time, took the bronze a further 0.06 seconds back.
South Africa's Joanne Russell, the morning's fastest qualifier, was fourth in 1:08.41. A mere 0.14 seconds separated the top four.
